required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Treat Patients Who Have Signs and Symptoms of Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) With Tadalafil Daily
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Design, Multinational Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Daily Tadalafil for 12 Weeks in Men With Signs and Symptoms of Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether an experimental drug known as tadalafil given once daily can reduce the symptoms associated with Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (straining, urinary frequency, feeling like your bladder is still full, etc.)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS)
primary_outcome.description: The IPSS Total Score is obtained by combining the scores of the responses to Question 1 through Question 7. Each question is scored from 0-5 for a total IPSS range of 0-35 points; higher numerical scores from the IPSS questionnaire represent greater severity of symptoms. Least squares (LS) mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an analysis of covariance (ANCOVA). The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 4 Weeks, Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) Impact Index
secondary_outcome.description: The BPH Impact Index (BII) is a 4-item, self-administered questionnaire evaluating impact of urinary problems on overall health and activity. Total scores range from 0 to 13; higher scores represent increased perceived impact of benign prostatic hyperplasia-lower urinary tract symptoms on overall health. LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) Impact Index
secondary_outcome.description: The BII is a 4-item, self-administered questionnaire evaluating impact of urinary problems on overall health and activity. Total scores range from 0 to 13; higher scores represent increased perceived impact of benign prostatic hyperplasia-lower urinary tract symptoms on overall health. LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) Storage (Irritative) Subscore
secondary_outcome.description: IPSS irritative subscore is the sum of Questions 2, 4 and 7 of the IPSS questionnaire. Scores range from 0 (few irritative symptoms) to 5 (frequent irritative symptoms), thus the 3 questions of the irritative subscore range from 0 to 15. LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) Voiding (Obstructive) Subscore
secondary_outcome.description: IPSS obstructive subscore is the sum of Questions 1, 3, 5 and 6 of the IPSS questionnaire. Scores range from 0 (few obstructive symptoms) to 5 (frequent obstructive symptoms), thus the 4 questions of the obstructive score range from 0 to 20. LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) Nocturia Question
secondary_outcome.description: Measures nocturia (the need to get up at night to urinate). Scores range from 0 (few episodes of nocturia) to 5 (frequent episodes of nocturia). LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) Quality of Life (QoL) Index
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of QoL by urinary symptoms, with scores ranging from 0 (delighted) to 6 (terrible). LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Global Impression of Improvement (PGI-I), Number of Participants in 7 Response Categories
secondary_outcome.description: A scale that measures the patient's perception of improvement at the time of assessment compared with the start of treatment. The score ranges from 1 (very much better) to 7 (very much worse).

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impression of Improvement (CGI-I), Number of Participants in 7 Response Categories
secondary_outcome.description: Measures clinician's perception of patient improvement at the time of assessment compared with the start of treatment. Scores range from 1 (very much better) to 7 (very much worse).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 1 Week, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS)
secondary_outcome.description: The IPSS Total Score is obtained by combining the scores of the responses to Question 1 through Question 7. Each question is scored from 0-5 for a total IPSS range of 0-35 points; higher numerical scores from the IPSS questionnaire represent greater severity of symptoms. LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 4 Weeks, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS)
secondary_outcome.description: The IPSS Total Score is obtained by combining the scores of the responses to Question 1 through Question 7. Each question is scored from 0-5 for a total IPSS range of 0-35 points; higher numerical scores from the IPSS questionnaire represent greater severity of symptoms. LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF)- Erectile Function (EF) Domain Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported EF. Scores range from 0 (low or no EF) to 5 (high EF) on 6 questions (1-5, 15 of the IIEF). EF Domain scores range from 0 to 30. LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, Peak Flow Rate (Qmax) by Uroflowmetry
secondary_outcome.description: Qmax was defined as the peak urine flow rate (measured in milliliters per second [mL/sec] using standard calibrated flowmeter). At each visit, a uroflowmetry assessment was considered valid and the data were included in the statistical analyses only if the prevoid total bladder volume (assessed by ultrasound) was >=150 to <=550 milliliters (mL) and the voided volume (Vcomp) was >=125 mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, Mean Flow Rate (Qmean) by Uroflowmetry
secondary_outcome.description: Qmean was defined as the mean urine flow rate (measured in mL/sec using standard calibrated flowmeter). At each visit, a uroflowmetry assessment was considered valid and the data were included in the statistical analyses only if the prevoid total bladder volume (assessed by ultrasound) was >=150 to <=550 mL and the Vcomp was >=125 mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, Voided Volume (Vcomp) by Uroflowmetry
secondary_outcome.description: Vcomp was defined as the volume of urine voided (measured in mL using standard calibrated flowmeter). At each visit, a uroflowmetry assessment was considered valid and the data were included in the statistical analyses only if the prevoid total bladder volume (assessed by ultrasound) was >=150 to <=550 mL and the Vcomp was >=125 mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, Postvoid Residual (PVR) Volume
secondary_outcome.description: The amount of urine remaining in the bladder after void completion.

intervention.description: Following a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects received placebo tablet by mouth once daily over a 12-week period.
Following a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects received tadalafil 5 mg tablet by mouth once daily over a 12-week period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men 45 years of age or older with Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) also referred to as BPH-LUTS [lower urinary tract symptoms] based on the disease diagnostic criteria at the start of study.
- Provide signed informed consent at the start of the study.
- Have not taken Finasteride therapy for at least 3 months before study drug is dispensed and Dutasteride therapy for at least 6 months before study drug is dispensed.
- Have not taken other BPH therapy (including herbal preparations), overactive bladder (OAB) therapy, or erectile dysfunction (ED) therapy for at least 4 weeks prior to study drug is dispensed.
- Agree not to use any other approved or experimental pharmacologic BPH, OAB, or ED treatments anytime during the study
- Have LUTS with a Total International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) greater than or equal to 13 when study drug is dispensed.
- Have reduced peak urine flow rate when study drug is dispensed (measured by a special toilet equipment).
- Demonstrate compliance with study drug administration requirements.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Treated with nitrates for a cardiac conditions.
- Have unstable angina or angina that requires treatment.
- Have had any of the following in the past 90 days: Heart attack, also known as a myocardial infarction (MI); Heart bypass surgery (called coronary artery bypass graft surgery); Had a procedure to open up blood vessels in the heart known as angioplasty or stent placement (percutaneous coronary intervention).
- Have very high or very low blood pressure
- Have problems with kidneys, liver, or nervous system.
- Have uncontrolled diabetes.
- Have had a stroke or a significant injury to brain or spinal cord.
- Have prostate cancer, are being treated for cancer or have clinical evidence of prostate cancer (Prostate-Specific Antigen [PSA] greater than 10 nanograms/milliliter [ng/ml] at the start of study).

group.title: Tadalafil
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive tadalafil 5 mg orally once daily over a 12-week period.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive placebo orally once daily over a 12-week period.

group.title: Tadalafil
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive tadalafil 5 mg orally once daily over a 12-week period.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive placebo orally once daily over a 12-week period.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender
Ethnicity (NIH/OMB)
Race (NIH/OMB)
measure.description: If a subject reported multiple race categories, he was counted as "more than one race", but not in any single category.

measure.title: Region of Enrollment
Body Mass Index (BMI)
measure.description: BMI is an estimate of body fat based on body weight divided by height squared.

measure.title: Baseline Lower Urinary Tract Symptoms (LUTS) Severity
measure.description: Baseline LUTS severity was assessed using the International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS). The IPSS Total Score is obtained by combining the scores of the responses to 1 through 7 component questions. Each question is scored from 0-5 for an IPSS range of 0-35 points; higher numerical scores from the IPSS questionnaire represent greater severity of symptoms. Moderate was considered an IPSS score <20. Severe was considered an IPSS>=20.

measure.title: Peak Urine Flow Rate (Qmax) Category
measure.description: Participants were categorized by Qmax: defined as the peak urine flow rate (measured in mL/second using standard calibrated flowmeter). Based on measurements from 305 randomized participants with a valid uroflowmetry assessment. Uroflowmetry assessments were considered valid and the data were included in statistical analyses only if the prevoid total bladder volume (assessed by ultrasound) was >=150 mL to <=550 mL and the volume of voided urine (Vcomp) was >=125 mL.

measure.title: Post-void Residual Volume (PVR)
measure.description: The amount of urine remaining in the bladder after void completion.

measure.title: Prostate-Specific Antigen (PSA)
measure.description: PSA is a tumor marker associated with prostate cancer. The participant population includes all randomized subjects with non-missing data (n=164 for placebo and n=160 for tadalafil).

measure.title: Erectile Dysfunction (ED)
measure.description: ED is defined as a consistent change in the quality of erection adversely affecting subject satisfaction with sexual intercourse.

measure.title: ED Severity
measure.description: ED is defined as a consistent change in the quality of erection adversely affecting subject satisfaction with sexual intercourse. Severity is based on investigator's opinion. Participant population includes all randomized subjects with ED.

measure.title: ED Duration
measure.description: ED is defined as a consistent change in the quality of erection adversely affecting subject satisfaction with sexual intercourse. Participant population includes all randomized subjects with ED.

measure.title: Sexually Active with a Female Partner
Expect to Remain Sexually Active
measure.description: Participant population is based on number of randomized subjects who are reported to be sexually active with a female partner.

measure.title: Patient Global Impression of Severity (PGI-S)
measure.description: Measures patient's perception of severity of illness at the time of assessment. The responses were grouped into an ordinal scale with 4 categories: normal; mild; moderate; and severe, and were based on postponing urination, straining to begin urination, a weak urinary stream, stopping and restarting urination several times when urinating, prolonged urination with the end of urine flow slowing to a trickle, bladder not feeling emptied after urinating, having to urinate again less than two hours after the last time urinating, accidental urinary leakage, or having to get up at night to urinate.

measure.title: Clinician Global Impression of Severity (CGI-S)
measure.description: Measures clinician's perception of severity of illness at the time of assessment. The responses were grouped into an ordinal scale with 4 categories: normal; mild; moderate; and severe, and were based on postponing urination, straining to begin urination, a weak urinary stream, stopping and restarting urination several times when urinating, prolonged urination with the end of urine flow slowing to a trickle, bladder not feeling emptied after urinating, having to urinate again less than two hours after the last time urinating, accidental urinary leakage, or having to get up at night to urinate.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS)
outcome.description: The IPSS Total Score is obtained by combining the scores of the responses to Question 1 through Question 7. Each question is scored from 0-5 for a total IPSS range of 0-35 points; higher numerical scores from the IPSS questionnaire represent greater severity of symptoms. Least squares (LS) mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an analysis of covariance (ANCOVA). The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.
outcome.population: The analysis population was defined as all subjects who were randomized, started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at least one post-baseline visit. The Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) imputation technique was employed.

group.title: Tadalafil
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive tadalafil 5 mg orally once daily over a 12-week period.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive placebo orally once daily over a 12-week period.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS)
measure.description: The IPSS Total Score is obtained by combining the scores of the responses to Question 1 through Question 7. Each question is scored from 0-5 for a total IPSS range of 0-35 points; higher numerical scores from the IPSS questionnaire represent greater severity of symptoms. Least squares (LS) mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an analysis of covariance (ANCOVA). The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.
measure.population: The analysis population was defined as all subjects who were randomized, started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at least one post-baseline visit. The Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) imputation technique was employed.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value associates with LS Mean difference of changes from baseline to 12 weeks between treatment groups for IPSS. Under the pre-specified fixed sequence testing procedure, the significance level of 0.05 is used for assessment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 4 Weeks, Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) Impact Index
outcome.description: The BPH Impact Index (BII) is a 4-item, self-administered questionnaire evaluating impact of urinary problems on overall health and activity. Total scores range from 0 to 13; higher scores represent increased perceived impact of benign prostatic hyperplasia-lower urinary tract symptoms on overall health. LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.
outcome.population: The analysis population includes all subjects who were randomized, started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and Week 4.

LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) Voiding (Obstructive) Subscore
outcome.description: IPSS obstructive subscore is the sum of Questions 1, 3, 5 and 6 of the IPSS questionnaire. Scores range from 0 (few obstructive symptoms) to 5 (frequent obstructive symptoms), thus the 4 questions of the obstructive score range from 0 to 20. LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.
outcome.population: The analysis population was defined as all randomized subjects who started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement. The LOCF imputation technique was employed.

group.title: Tadalafil
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive tadalafil 5 mg orally once daily over a 12-week period.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive placebo orally once daily over a 12-week period.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) Voiding (Obstructive) Subscore
measure.description: IPSS obstructive subscore is the sum of Questions 1, 3, 5 and 6 of the IPSS questionnaire. Scores range from 0 (few obstructive symptoms) to 5 (frequent obstructive symptoms), thus the 4 questions of the obstructive score range from 0 to 20. LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.
measure.population: The analysis population was defined as all randomized subjects who started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement. The LOCF imputation technique was employed.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value associates with LS Mean difference of changes from baseline to 12 weeks between treatment groups for IPSS voiding subscore. Under the pre-specified fixed sequence testing procedure, the significance level of 0.05 is used for assessment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) Nocturia Question
outcome.description: Measures nocturia (the need to get up at night to urinate). Scores range from 0 (few episodes of nocturia) to 5 (frequent episodes of nocturia). LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.
outcome.population: The analysis population was defined as all randomized subjects who started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement. The LOCF imputation technique was employed.

group.title: Tadalafil
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive tadalafil 5 mg orally once daily over a 12-week period.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive placebo orally once daily over a 12-week period.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) Nocturia Question
measure.description: Measures nocturia (the need to get up at night to urinate). Scores range from 0 (few episodes of nocturia) to 5 (frequent episodes of nocturia). LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.
measure.population: The analysis population was defined as all randomized subjects who started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement. The LOCF imputation technique was employed.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value associates with LS Mean difference of changes from baseline to 12 weeks between treatment groups for IPSS nocturia question. Under the pre-specified fixed sequence testing procedure, the significance level of 0.05 is used for assessment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) Quality of Life (QoL) Index
outcome.description: Assessment of QoL by urinary symptoms, with scores ranging from 0 (delighted) to 6 (terrible). LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.
outcome.population: The analysis population was defined as all randomized subjects who started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement. The LOCF imputation technique was employed.

group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive tadalafil 5 mg orally once daily over a 12-week period.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive placebo orally once daily over a 12-week period.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) Quality of Life (QoL) Index
measure.description: Assessment of QoL by urinary symptoms, with scores ranging from 0 (delighted) to 6 (terrible). LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.
measure.population: The analysis population was defined as all randomized subjects who started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement. The LOCF imputation technique was employed.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value associates with LS Mean difference of changes from baseline to 12 weeks between treatment groups for IPSS QoL Index. Under the pre-specified fixed sequence testing procedure, the significance level of 0.05 is used for assessment.

outcome.title: Patient Global Impression of Improvement (PGI-I), Number of Participants in 7 Response Categories
outcome.description: A scale that measures the patient's perception of improvement at the time of assessment compared with the start of treatment. The score ranges from 1 (very much better) to 7 (very much worse).
outcome.population: The analysis population includes all subjects who were randomized, started study medication, and had non-missing data.

group.title: Tadalafil
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive tadalafil 5 mg orally once daily over a 12-week period.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive placebo orally once daily over a 12-week period.

measure.title: Patient Global Impression of Improvement (PGI-I), Number of Participants in 7 Response Categories
measure.description: A scale that measures the patient's perception of improvement at the time of assessment compared with the start of treatment. The score ranges from 1 (very much better) to 7 (very much worse).
measure.population: The analysis population includes all subjects who were randomized, started study medication, and had non-missing data.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value associates with difference between treatment groups for the 7 response categories.
analysis.method_desc: Results were adjusted for baseline LUTS severity (moderate [total IPSS < 20]; severe [total IPSS >= 20]

outcome.title: Clinical Global Impression of Improvement (CGI-I), Number of Participants in 7 Response Categories
outcome.description: Measures clinician's perception of patient improvement at the time of assessment compared with the start of treatment. Scores range from 1 (very much better) to 7 (very much worse).
outcome.population: All values are based on the number of subjects in the analysis population with non-missing data.

group.title: Tadalafil
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive tadalafil 5 mg orally once daily over a 12-week period.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive placebo orally once daily over a 12-week period.

measure.title: Clinical Global Impression of Improvement (CGI-I), Number of Participants in 7 Response Categories
measure.description: Measures clinician's perception of patient improvement at the time of assessment compared with the start of treatment. Scores range from 1 (very much better) to 7 (very much worse).
measure.population: All values are based on the number of subjects in the analysis population with non-missing data.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value associates with difference between treatment groups for the 7 response categories.
analysis.method_desc: Results were adjusted for baseline LUTS severity (moderate [total IPSS < 20]; severe [total IPSS >= 20]

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 1 Week, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS)
outcome.description: The IPSS Total Score is obtained by combining the scores of the responses to Question 1 through Question 7. Each question is scored from 0-5 for a total IPSS range of 0-35 points; higher numerical scores from the IPSS questionnaire represent greater severity of symptoms. LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.
outcome.population: The analysis population includes all subjects who were randomized, started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and Week 1.

group.title: Tadalafil
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive tadalafil 5 mg orally once daily over a 12-week period.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive placebo orally once daily over a 12-week period.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to 1 Week, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS)
measure.description: The IPSS Total Score is obtained by combining the scores of the responses to Question 1 through Question 7. Each question is scored from 0-5 for a total IPSS range of 0-35 points; higher numerical scores from the IPSS questionnaire represent greater severity of symptoms. LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.
measure.population: The analysis population includes all subjects who were randomized, started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and Week 1.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value associates with LS Mean difference of changes from baseline to 1 week between treatment groups for IPSS. Under the pre-specified fixed sequence testing procedure, the significance level of 0.05 is used for assessment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 4 Weeks, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS)
outcome.description: The IPSS Total Score is obtained by combining the scores of the responses to Question 1 through Question 7. Each question is scored from 0-5 for a total IPSS range of 0-35 points; higher numerical scores from the IPSS questionnaire represent greater severity of symptoms. LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.
outcome.population: The analysis population includes all subjects who were randomized, started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and Week 4.

group.title: Tadalafil
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive tadalafil 5 mg orally once daily over a 12-week period.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive placebo orally once daily over a 12-week period.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to 4 Weeks, International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS)
measure.description: The IPSS Total Score is obtained by combining the scores of the responses to Question 1 through Question 7. Each question is scored from 0-5 for a total IPSS range of 0-35 points; higher numerical scores from the IPSS questionnaire represent greater severity of symptoms. LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.
measure.population: The analysis population includes all subjects who were randomized, started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and Week 4.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value associates with LS Mean difference of changes from baseline to 4 weeks between treatment groups for IPSS. Under the pre-specified fixed sequence testing procedure, the significance level of 0.05 is used for assessment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF)- Erectile Function (EF) Domain Scores
outcome.description: Self-reported EF. Scores range from 0 (low or no EF) to 5 (high EF) on 6 questions (1-5, 15 of the IIEF). EF Domain scores range from 0 to 30. LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.
outcome.population: The analysis population was defined as all randomized subjects who started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement. Measures were taken only for those subjects who reported they were sexually active and reported erectile dysfunction. The LOCF imputation technique was employed.

group.title: Tadalafil
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive tadalafil 5 mg orally once daily over a 12-week period.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive placebo orally once daily over a 12-week period.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF)- Erectile Function (EF) Domain Scores
measure.description: Self-reported EF. Scores range from 0 (low or no EF) to 5 (high EF) on 6 questions (1-5, 15 of the IIEF). EF Domain scores range from 0 to 30. LS mean of change from baseline to endpoint is from an ANCOVA. The model includes terms for treatment group, region, centered-baseline covariate, centered-baseline-by-treatment interaction and treatment-by-region interaction.
measure.population: The analysis population was defined as all randomized subjects who started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement. Measures were taken only for those subjects who reported they were sexually active and reported erectile dysfunction. The LOCF imputation technique was employed.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value associates with LS Mean difference of changes from baseline to 12 weeks between treatment groups for IIEF-EF domain score. Under the pre-specified fixed sequence testing procedure, the significance level of 0.05 is used for assessment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, Peak Flow Rate (Qmax) by Uroflowmetry
outcome.description: Qmax was defined as the peak urine flow rate (measured in milliliters per second [mL/sec] using standard calibrated flowmeter). At each visit, a uroflowmetry assessment was considered valid and the data were included in the statistical analyses only if the prevoid total bladder volume (assessed by ultrasound) was >=150 to <=550 milliliters (mL) and the voided volume (Vcomp) was >=125 mL.
outcome.population: The analysis population was defined as all randomized subjects who started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at endpoint (considered the last non-missing post-baseline value).

group.title: Tadalafil
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive tadalafil 5 mg orally once daily over a 12-week period.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Following screening, a 4-week washout period (if needed) and a 4-week placebo lead-in period, subjects were randomized to receive placebo orally once daily over a 12-week period.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, Peak Flow Rate (Qmax) by Uroflowmetry
measure.description: Qmax was defined as the peak urine flow rate (measured in milliliters per second [mL/sec] using standard calibrated flowmeter). At each visit, a uroflowmetry assessment was considered valid and the data were included in the statistical analyses only if the prevoid total bladder volume (assessed by ultrasound) was >=150 to <=550 milliliters (mL) and the voided volume (Vcomp) was >=125 mL.
measure.population: The analysis population was defined as all randomized subjects who started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at endpoint (considered the last non-missing post-baseline value).

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value associates with mean difference of changes from baseline to 12 weeks between treatment groups for Qmax. Under the pre-specified fixed sequence testing procedure, the significance level of 0.05 is used for assessment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, Mean Flow Rate (Qmean) by Uroflowmetry
outcome.description: Qmean was defined as the mean urine flow rate (measured in mL/sec using standard calibrated flowmeter). At each visit, a uroflowmetry assessment was considered valid and the data were included in the statistical analyses only if the prevoid total bladder volume (assessed by ultrasound) was >=150 to <=550 mL and the Vcomp was >=125 mL.
outcome.population: The analysis population was defined as all randomized subjects who started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at endpoint (considered the last non-missing post-baseline value).

group.title: Placebo

At each visit, a uroflowmetry assessment was considered valid and the data were included in the statistical analyses only if the prevoid total bladder volume (assessed by ultrasound) was >=150 to <=550 mL and the Vcomp was >=125 mL.
measure.population: The analysis population was defined as all randomized subjects who started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at endpoint (considered the last non-missing post-baseline value).

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, Voided Volume (Vcomp) by Uroflowmetry
outcome.description: Vcomp was defined as the volume of urine voided (measured in mL using standard calibrated flowmeter). At each visit, a uroflowmetry assessment was considered valid and the data were included in the statistical analyses only if the prevoid total bladder volume (assessed by ultrasound) was >=150 to <=550 mL and the Vcomp was >=125 mL.
outcome.population: The analysis population was defined as all randomized subjects who started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at endpoint (considered the last non-missing post-baseline value).

measure.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, Voided Volume (Vcomp) by Uroflowmetry
measure.description: Vcomp was defined as the volume of urine voided (measured in mL using standard calibrated flowmeter). At each visit, a uroflowmetry assessment was considered valid and the data were included in the statistical analyses only if the prevoid total bladder volume (assessed by ultrasound) was >=150 to <=550 mL and the Vcomp was >=125 mL.
measure.population: The analysis population was defined as all randomized subjects who started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at endpoint (considered the last non-missing post-baseline value).

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks, Postvoid Residual (PVR) Volume
outcome.description: The amount of urine remaining in the bladder after void completion.
outcome.population: The analysis population was defined as all randomized subjects who started study medication, and had non-missing data at baseline and at endpoint (considered the last non-missing post-baseline value).

group.title: Placebo

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value associates with mean difference of changes from baseline to 12 weeks between treatment groups for PVR volume. Under the pre-specified fixed sequence testing procedure, the significance level of 0.05 is used for assessment.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
